intro: Remijia hubbardiorum, commonly known as the Hubbard's remijia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and umbel-like inflorescence. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it blooms in the spring. Remijia hubbardiorum is often found in open woodlands and along creek banks, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun.
